column4: hey, if nobody is logged into my computer I can't seem to ssh into the computer unless someone is logged into the machine? Would anyone know why this would be?
but if I use the machine and actually log in as a user it will let me ssh into the machine after
wired or wirelesses  networking?
wired
login via the console on the server. not x as a test. see if it works
dies ping also fail?
yeah, and it doesn't seem to be up until I log in through gdm
whish is why i said try the console login. not  x.
on the machine itself? or on my ssh client?
will I have to log out of tty7?
when I logged into tty1 and I tried to ctrl alt f7 to get back and talk to you it just had a black screen and said sabnzbd was starting
okay, I'll grab one of those, log into tty1 then come back?
a dirty fix could be to restart networking from /etc/rc.local
so just sudo /etc/rc.local restart?
you are a genius. tty8 works. you still think restarting networking would do it?
so would I just sudo /etc/rc.local restart then? is that how that would work?
so how would I restart networking from there?
I did do one thing. Ubuntu notified me of a kernel upgrade, so I did that. I don't know if this is when the issue started isnce I haven't had to ssh into here for a while
where would I edit the startup daemons? Would that be in the rc.local?
network manager icon on the top right panel on desktop
yeah, it says it should connect automatically :/
restarted and things worked fine :S
